parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) an exit, going out, departure from a place; the exodus, (b) death. From ek and hodos; an exit, i.e. death.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
